content:
Diagnosis:	Bilateral breast cancer - synchronous

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Right mastectomy and axillary clearance
		22 Jan 2024 Left wide local excision and sentinel node biopsy

Histology:	Right: T2N1 (2/12) oncocytic carcinoma, ER 8/8, PR 7/8, HER2 negative
		Left: T1N0 oncocytic carcinoma, ER 8/8, PR 8/8, HER2 negative

Current Situation:	Cycle 4 FEC chemotherapy

I reviewed [redacted name] today prior to cycle 4 FEC. She has managed the previous cycle relatively well with only grade 1 nausea and mild fatigue lasting 5 days. The initial neutropenic sepsis after cycle 1 has not recurred since starting GCSF prophylaxis. Her surgical wounds have healed well.?

On examination today there is no evidence of local recurrence. The right chest wall shows good healing. The left breast shows expected post-surgical and radiotherapy changes only.? Blood results are satisfactory for proceeding with treatment.?

We will proceed with cycle 4 today and review again in 3 weeks. The breast care nurse will contact her by telephone next week to check on side effects.

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: Right: ER 8/8, PR 7/8, HER2 negative; Left: ER 8/8, PR 8/8, HER2 negative

cancer_timeline.value: Left wide local excision and sentinel node biopsy
Started FEC chemotherapy with GCSF prophylaxis
Added GCSF prophylaxis after neutropenic sepsis following cycle 1

patient_facts.value: Grade 1 nausea and mild fatigue lasting 5 days after chemotherapy
No evidence of local recurrence, right chest wall healing well, left breast shows expected post-surgical and radiotherapy changes

status_updates.value: Bilateral breast cancer post-surgery, tolerating adjuvant FEC chemotherapy with prophylactic GCSF support after initial neutropenic sepsis
Grade 1 nausea and fatigue with cycle 3
Review in clinic in 3 weeks, telephone follow-up by breast care nurse next week
